content: A comment like “Kanban didn’t change anything” suggests tool-focused thinking about organizational change. Involvement of leadership and buy-in to an improvement process based on what they see in the visualizations would be part of triggering real change, and often this part of the process is bypassed, in the hopes that just seeing the information would magically trigger the right thinking and organizational change. This is often difficult for insiders to do, because of system dynamics based on where the IT organization sits in the organization, and is one of the key values (as you know!) of bringing in someone from outside, who is not bound by the same unwritten rules.
